why_it_matters.title: Why Runtime Authority Matters
why_it_matters.intro: Modern AI systems don't just respond — they act.
agents: read and write to enterprise systems

why_it_matters.traditional: Traditional AI security focuses on filtering inputs at the perimeter. That is no longer sufficient once systems are inside the environment and operating with authorized identities.
why_it_matters.conclusion: Data Science Technologies secures what AI systems do at runtime — not just what they say.

foundation.intro: The Force Field LLM Firewall is our foundation — a production-ready, low-latency enforcement layer that sits directly in the execution path of AI systems.
foundation.evolution: Built on that foundation, we are evolving toward execution-level controls that govern:
controls: and when authority must be revoked in real time
foundation.conclusion: This evolution forms the basis of a control plane that allows organizations to safely adopt agentic AI at scale.

diagram.title: How Runtime Authority Works
diagram.flow: User / Agent → LLM Reasoning → Runtime Authority Layer → Tools & Systems
diagram.caption: Runtime authority evaluates and governs actions as they occur — not after the fact.
